meanings.definition: A person or thing that splutters.
meanings.sent1: The old car's splutterers were loud as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent2: The splutterers of the broken faucet kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: The splutterers in the movie made the audience giggle.
meanings.sent4: The splutterers of the engine were like a symphony of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The chef's splutterers while cooking added a touch of excitement to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Those who make a series of incoherent or confused sounds.
meanings.sent1: The children were known as the class splutterers for their constant chatter.
meanings.sent2: The splutterers in the crowd made it hard to hear the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's splutterers mimicking the phone ringing were hilarious.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the splutterers of the animals created a cacophony of noise.
meanings.sent5: The splutterers of the radio station host were entertaining to listen to.
